utterance.speaker: Jennifer
utterance.content: Previously on Friends...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How did the job stuff go?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He offered me one.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know what? This calls for a bottle of Israels finest.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: The job is in Paris.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, God! Please, somebody say something.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So if you take this job you'll be moving to Paris?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Or facing a bitch of a commute.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know, it's huge, and it's scary, and it's... really far, far away from you guys, but this is such an incredible opportunity for me. And I've already talked to them about our situation with Emma, and they said they'll do whatever we need to make us feel comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean, I'll fly back and forth, they'll fly you out... Anything we want.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: My boss said I might be getting a new lamp in my cubicle.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, we'll work it out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you! Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah! You sure this is what you want?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I think it is.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, what's going on?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I got a really incredible job offer.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, great! All right!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good for you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It's in Paris.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? No, no, no! No, no... no... no, no... No, too much is changing, okay? First, Phoebe getting married Congratulations! ... and then these two move into a stupid house in the stupid suburbs...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, this afternoon you said you'd be supportive...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, it comes and goes. I wouldn't trust it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look, you guys... this is really, really important to me. And it means a lot if you could try to get on board.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Of course we can. Congratulations. Yay! Joey...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no. My hugs are reserved for people STAYING IN AMERICA.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, it would mean so...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! No! Get your France-going-arms away from me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You okay with this?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, it makes me feel sad, but...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Talking to Ross.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I see.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, Rachel moving to another country? Not being able to see her every day. How can I be okay with this?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know, but what are we gonna do? She really needs this job.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Do you think if the Ralph Lauren people offered her her old job back, she would take it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How is that gonna happen?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is this the best way to use one of your three magic wishes?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know. I could talk to her boss. Yeah! I met him at that Christmas party. We really hit it off.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You mean the guy who kept calling you Ron?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I didn't say we were brothers.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Phoebe. Hey, tell me what you think. All right. The house next door to the one that we're buying in Westchester? Just went on the market. I wanna take a look at it, but Chandler doesn't.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We close escrow tomorrow, so seeing another house can only confuse us, and we're easily confused. We're not very bright.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But what if it is better than ours? Should we at least look?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What do you think Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I think that shirt makes you look like you should work at a Baskin Robbins... Anyway... Hey, isn't Joey's agent Estelle Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She died.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You're kidding!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's terrible!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, last Saturday. Wow! She was the first black man to fly solo across the Atlantic. Oh, wait a minute, I read the wrong one.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, she was just an agent.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey's gonna be *so* upset.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know. *He* always wanted to be the first black man to cross the Atlantic.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, we cannot tell Joey about this. He's already flipping out about everything that's changing. This will push him over the edge.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Seriously, you don't think we should tell him?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, not for a little while. Let's just give him a few days to get used to everything else.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What if he reads it in the paper?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Unless Snoopy says it to Charlie Brown, I think we're okay.

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: May I help you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm a friend of Rachel Green's. Uhm, actually we met at the Christmas party about two years ago.

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: Oh right, uhm, Don?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Close. Ron.

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: Uh... What can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uhm, well... I'm here to see if you'll give Rachel her job back.

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: Ah, did she ask you to come here and do this?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, no. At first I have to get you to agree. Then we'll see if she wants to come back.

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: Wow, that is tempting.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, she loved her job here. And let's face it: you're not gonna find anyone who did it as well as she did it. Isn't that true?

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: She is good!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh, I took a shot there.

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: But I'm sorry. There's nothing I can do... Ah, it's not true, there is... nothing I want to do.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I see... Thanks very much. Is this your son?

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: Yeah, his name is Ross. What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, nothing, it’s just, it’s close to Ron. Does he.. Does little Ross like dinosaurs by any chance?

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: Yeah, they're all he talks about, why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How would he like to come with me to the Museum of Natural History after everyone else has left, just the two of us, and he can touch anything he wants. . I just heard it as you must have heard it and that’s not good. Let me start again. I’m a paleontologist, you’ll be there with us and the touching refers only to bones… fossils!

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: You can really arrange that?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You let Rachel come back, and it’s done.

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: Well, I guess having Rachel back wouldn’t be the worst thing in the world.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah! Yes! Thank you! This is great. Thank you so much. And I swear, your kid is going to have the time of his life.

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: That’s great. I worry about little Ross. He’s always reading, he's collecting rocks and he’s obsessed with dinosaurs.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: He’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey. Everything ok?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m just mad at my agent.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Estelle? Why?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: There’s a part in a TV movie that I would be perfect for and I didn’t even be put up for it! She’d better have a good reason.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m guessing she does.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well I’m wanna hear it, because she keeps doing this.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, no, no, wait, wait, wait. All right, I gotta go. Just listen. Promise me, that you will wait a minute before you call her.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ok. Why?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Because a promise between friends means never having to give a reason.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I love that saying!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I was just gonna call you! That’s weird.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, actually I am!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s it? You know, it seems all you do lately is drop the ball.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, look. All I’m saying is that you’re my agent, ok? And you’re not getting me into any auditions and I’m tired of it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m saying that… . This isn't working for me anymore, ok? Estelle, you’re fired. Goodbye. .

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Man, tough week for Estelle!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Emma left her stuffed t-rex at my house. You know she can’t sleep without it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, well, she’s asleep now. Stop forcing that thing on her.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you’re not gonna believe what happened to me today! Ralph Lauren called, and gave me my job back!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nooo!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yee. I mean, it was so weirdest thing. They fired me and then out of nowhere they just hire me back! I mean, that place must have been falling apart without me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, you’re not going to Paris.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I’m still going.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wh… wh…what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: When the Louis Vuitton people found out that Ralph Lauren wanted me back, the offered me more money! Isn’t that great?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeeeah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi. We’re buying the house next door, and we were wondering if we could just take a look around.

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: Oh, sure. I’m showing it to someone else right now, but please, look around.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It feels like we’re cheating on our house. And if we’re gonna cheat, shouldn’t it be with like a hot, younger house, that does stuff that our house won’t do?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ours is so much better! This living room is smaller, the dining room looks like a cave! What a hole!

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: So? What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Love it!

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: Well, we already have one offer on it, and I think the lady upstairs is goning to make another one.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They could be our neighbors, what are they like?

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: Oh, the woman upstairs is very nice. She and her husband have two kids, he's on Wall Street and she…

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey Joey, want come with me to… are you ok?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, I just… I just feel bad about firing Estelle. This is got to be killing her.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, that wouldn’t kill her. Ordinary embolism might.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know. She’s got to be taking it hard, I was like her only client. Except for this guy who eats paper. And I’m guessing he eats more money than he makes. Look, I know she’s not a great agent, but she did stick with me for ten years. I’m gonna call her and hire her again.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no, no! Don't call her! You wait for her to call you

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Because patience is the road to understanding which ... is the key... to a happy heart.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You blow me away.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, so promise you're gonna wait for her to call you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I promise. And that means, never having to give a reason.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: What a small world!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And yet I never run into Beyonce!

utterance.speaker: Realtor
utterance.content: You two know each other?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh, we go way back. Before Monica made an honest man out of him, Chandler used to be my little love muffin! . So? Are you guys thinking of getting this house too? Ooh! Are we gonna have a bidding war? I'd better warn you, I'm a toughie

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don't, don't!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, actually, we're buying the house next door.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why!?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don't know why.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Ooh, that decides it then. I was on the fence. But knowing that you two would be our neighbors? Ah! now we have to get it! Ellen, we're going to talk numbers.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This can not be happening!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, the realtor said another couple made an offer. Maybe the Janice's won't get it! Maybe the other couple will.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The only way that that is going to happen, is if the other couple are the Hitlers.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, Okay, All right. What if we got both houses? Huh? We can turn this house into a guest house.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That is a great idea! And by the way, I don't mean to sound distasteful, but when did you start crapping money!?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, you come up with an idea.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Alright alright, we still have three hours till escrow closes on our house. We can still get out.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But we love our house.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Will we love it so much with her next door? And she's gonna be louder out here too. Just the crickets and "Oh My God"!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, but if we don't get this house, she's stil gonna show up wherever we go! I mean, at least if she's here, it eliminates the element of suprise. I mean, never again will you have to hear the three words that make your balls jump back up inside your body.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, we have to do something. We can't have her living next door. Oh, that does it too.

utterance.speaker: r Zelner
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It's me. Ron. Look, I um, I now Rachel turned you down but I think there is a way you might be able to get her to come back.

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: This may surprise you, but re-hiring fired employees, is not my main job.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just hear me out. How would you feel about offering her a raise?

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: Not good, Ron.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Perhaps I can persuade you. What if you can give your son this genuine pterodactyl egg replica.

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: Wow, that's pretty cool

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh? So? We have a deal?

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: Okay, you got it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes! yes!

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: This is gonna make me very popular.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, Believe me, the ladies, they love it!

utterance.speaker: Mr Zelner
utterance.content: I meant with my son.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Good, 'cause the ladies, not so much.

utterance.speaker: Answering machine
utterance.content: Joey, this is Al T. Booker, the guy who eats paper. I'm sure you've heard that Estelle passed away. I wanted to let you know there's a memorial for her at the Westside chapel, tomorrow at ten. Hope you can make it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my God. Hello?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Joey, it's Estelle.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Estelle?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I wanted to call and tell you that there's no hard feelings for firing me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ok-ay. I just, I can't believe you're calling me?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I didn't think I should just drop by...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no! Don't drop by, don't drop by!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Anyway, you did what you had to do. I'm okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Can I ask you something? Uhm, what's it like there?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's alright. Look kiddo, I gotta go. Good luck with the career. You're gonna be huge.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks for everything Estelle. Bye. "out of area". Boy, I'll say.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Well... I just talked to Sid, we are definitely putting in an offer on the house... a-a-and I'll bet we get it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The Hitlers will be so disappointed.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: All right, I got to run. Tell Monica I say goodbye. And... I'll see you later, neighbor.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wait! I just want you to know that... I'm so happy you're going to be here.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh, me too...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because... that way... we can pick up where we left off.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I never stopped loving you.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh... my...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah! I want you... I need you... I must have you Janice Litman Goralnik Neihosenstein.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Chandler, what are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Now that you live next door, we can be together every day. Sid and Monica never have to know a thing.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: I don't know what to say... I mean, you know, obviously we have this... heat between us.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Obviously.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: But I love my husband. And I know you love your wife. Now, I don't think we should get this house now.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don't say that. Don't tangle the dream and take it away.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Chandler, one of us has got to be strong.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I understand.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Although, maybe just... one last moment of weakness... Goodbye Chandler Bing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: They're never coming down now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You are never going to believe what happened to me today.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ralph Lauren called again and they offered me more money.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: They did?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. It was the weirdest thing. Zelner called me and he said we'll do everything we can to get you back. And that I should thank some Ron... I don't even know what department that guy's in.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, what are you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I took it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That's great! So you're staying in New York!

utterance.speaker: Both
utterance.content: YAY! WHOO! YAY!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You're excited, right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ye-ah. Yeah! You know, the money's great. It's certainly the easier choice...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Right!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, you know, was I looking forward to going to Paris? Sure. You know, was I excited about working in the fashion capital of the world? Ooh, absolutely... Oh...! Yeah, but you know, this is... it's fine. I'm fine going back to a job where I've pretty much gotten everything out of that I possibly can...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uhm, I hadn't no you... I had no idea you were so excited about Paris. Uhm, I mean, you said you were scared.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well yeah, but I mean, it was good scared though, you know? Like when I-moved-to-New-York scared. Or uhm, when I-found-out-I-was-gonna-have-Emma scared... But this is... fine. This is gonna be good.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You should go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It's what you want. You should go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You really think so?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I really do.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But I already told Zelner that I would come back...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm sure he'll understand.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right. ALL RIGHT! I'm gonna do it. I'm gonna go to Paris.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! I'm going to Paris. Thank you, Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, oh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Oh, I'm so happy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Then I'm happy too.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thank you all for coming. We're here today to pay respects to a wonderful agent and a beautiful woman... ..inside. As Estelle's only two clients we would like to say a few words. Dude, where's my speech? That is entertaining. Al Zebooker everybody.
